intro: Microlicia sparsifolia, commonly known as the sparsely-leaved microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
